module.name: userhelper
module.summary: SELinux utility to run a shell with a new role

template.name: userhelper_per_role_template
template.summary: The per role template for the userhelper module.

desc.p: This template creates a derived domains which are used for userhelper.
This template is invoked automatically for each user, and generally does not need to be invoked directly by policy writers.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

param.name: user_domain
param.summary: The type of the user domain.

param.name: user_role
param.summary: The role associated with the user domain.

interface.name: userhelper_dontaudit_search_config
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to search the userhelper configuration directory.

template.name: userhelper_use_user_fd
template.summary: Allow domain to use userhelper file descriptor.

param.name: prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the domain, example user is the prefix of user_t.

template.name: userhelper_sigchld_user
template.summary: Allow domain to send sigchld to userhelper.

param.name: prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the domain, example user is the prefix of user_t.

interface.name: userhelper_exec
interface.summary: Execute the userhelper program in the caller domain.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The type of the process performing this action.
